results.title: Bus Stop
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Buddy Adler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A naive, young cowboy coming to Phoenix for the big rodeo, falls in love with the first woman he sees. She happens to be Marilyn Monroe, playing a “chantoosie” in a cheap bar, and he has to almost kidnap her, get beaten up for her, and perform majestically in the rodeo before she reciprocates his love. Don Murray gives a boisterous performance as the cowboy in the big city, but Monroe steals the film in what is considered one of her best performances. Based on the play “Bus Stop” by William Inge.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joshua Logan, Buddy Adler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: They were expendable
results.brief_description: Robert Montgomery and John Wayne are naval lieutenants stationed in the Philippines who are keen to test their squadrons and equipment in battle. They get the chance to do so when the Japanese attack Pearl Harbour and the US enters World War II. Donna Reed also features as a nurse falling in love with Wayne, but the relationship takes second place to the brilliant staging and editing of the navy and air battles. In the bloody and intense war scenes Ford shows his brilliance as a film director. Based on the novel of the same name by William L. White.

results.title: Mad Max (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Byron Kennedy, Kennedy Miller Productions and Mad Max Films
results.brief_description: Mad Max marked the debut of Australian director George Miller and his first collaboration with Mel Gibson. Part science fiction, part road movie, “Mad Max” is a futuristic vision of a post-apocalyptic Australia where ordered society is fast disintegrating into violent chaos. In this anarchic setting, rogue gangs menacingly roam the land in search of petrol (a vital and increasingly scarce resource), spoils of looting and bloodthirsty fun. Mel Gibson stars as Max Rockatansky, a good cop made mad by the death of his wife and child and the hands of a gang of feral bikies. The film follows Max as he embarks on a personal vendetta to avenge the death of his family, armed with anger, a gun and his car - “the last of the V-8 interceptors”. “Mad Max” has a much-imitated visual and thematic style - gang members are clad in filthy rags with maimed bodies; the landscape is bleak and featureless; camps are transitory pit-stops between war zones; and machines rule their owners. “Mad Max”, with its ordinary hero and car culture narrative, fits neatly into the zeitgeist of 1970s filmmaking. A nihilistic road movie, fuelled by male angst, “Mad Max” is a thrilling, truly original film that remains a highlight of Australian film history.

results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Luis Valdez, Taylor Hackford, New Visions Pictures and Columbia
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: Oliver (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Wolf, Romulus Films, Warwick and Columbia
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: Atlantic City USA
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Denis Heroux, Selta Films and Cine-Neighbour
results.brief_description: The legalisation of gambling in Atlantic City brings about big changes in the life of an aging, smalltime numbers runner, especially when he meets up with a beautiful younger woman who entangles him with the Mob. Starring Burt Lancaster and Susan Sarandon.

results.title: Manon des Sources
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Stars Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.

results.title: Go West
results.creator_credit: Edward Buzzell, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers go to America’s wild west where the man who gets the deed to Dead Man’s Gulch gets rich. Groucho, Chico and Harpo go west in search of the deed. Filled with typical Marx Brothers’ lunacy, “Go West” climaxes with the wildest train chase on film. Cast also includes John Carroll, Diana lewis, Walter Woolf King, Robert Barrat.

results.title: The Little Mermaid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ron Clements, John Musker, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid” based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen is full of dazzling animation.

results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.
